One way ANOVA - Assignment


Considering these three classes and their grades, please perform the step-by-step ANOVA analysis, and interpret the results:


> y1 = c(18.2, 20.1, 17.6, 16.8, 18.8, 19.7, 19.1)

> y2 = c(17.4, 18.7, 19.1, 16.4, 15.9, 18.4, 17.7)

> y3 = c(15.2, 18.8, 17.7, 16.5, 15.9, 17.1, 16.7)


What group(s) is different than the others and how?


```{r}
y1 <- c(18.2, 20.1, 17.6, 16.8, 18.8, 19.7, 19.1)
y2 <- c(17.4, 18.7, 19.1, 16.4, 15.9, 18.4, 17.7)
y3 <- c(15.2, 18.8, 17.7, 16.5, 15.9, 17.1, 16.7)

score<-data.frame(y1,y2,y3)
score<-stack(score)
result<-aov(values~ind,data=score)
summary(result)
```
notice p=0.0373<0.05, we need to find out how means are different

```{r}
pairwise.t.test(score$values,score$ind,p.adjust.method = "bonferroni")

```

we can see that y1 and y3 are significant different in population means
